meanings.definition: The motion of swinging a golf club or racket backwards before striking the ball.
meanings.sent1: During his backswing, the golfer carefully positioned the club behind his shoulder.
meanings.sent2: She always takes a smooth backswing before hitting the tennis ball.
meanings.sent3: The robot's backswing was so exaggerated that it accidentally hit the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: Her backswing was like a graceful dance move, flowing effortlessly through the air.
meanings.sent5: The backswing of the pendulum was mesmerizing to watch, its arc precise and controlled.

meanings.definition: A movement backwards or away from something.
meanings.sent1: The sudden backswing of the door startled the cat, making it jump back.
meanings.sent2: His backswing away from the edge of the cliff saved him from falling.
meanings.sent3: The backswing of the swing set made the children giggle as they flew higher and higher.
meanings.sent4: The backswing of the pendulum symbolized the passage of time, swinging back and forth endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The backswing of the wrecking ball was powerful, demolishing the old building with ease.
